questions.neutral: Feels cooler down here, doesn't it?

hobby.message: Political literature still your guilty pleasure?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah. Cooler is good. Easier to think here.
I fly FPV drones—just hobby stuff, nothing major.
Haven't had much time for it lately. Too much chaos in the city.
Crowds move differently now. Noticed that on my last flight.
Cool air's better than outside right now.
My hobby's flying freestyle drones, old industrial zones mostly.
Keeps my head clear from work noise.
Lately, too many people around those spots, chasing puzzle app things.
Doesn't really feel private anymore.
Yeah, it is cooler. Reminds me of old warehouse basements.
I do FPV drone flying—goggles, manual controls, full freestyle.
Usually stick to off-grid industrial areas. Clears up stress from the job.
Last week, those places were crowded. App scavenger hunt, I think.
Almost landed on someone hunting for a cache.
Flying isn’t as peaceful when you can't tune out the city.
Feels good to be someplace insulated from all that outside noise.
I’m into FPV drone flying—manual, always outdoors, keeps me sane.
Usually fly in quiet industrial zones, away from city monitoring.
But lately, it's changed—crowds hunting clues from that puzzle app.
My last session got tense. Random people digging for hidden boxes.
Had to finish quick. Drone footage caught them pulling out lists—real names too.
Reminded me why I started flying: for the quiet, not this surveillance mess.
Yeah, cooler air helps. Easier to breathe, to think. Needed that lately.
Not sure if you know—I fly FPV drones, freestyle, been doing it a while.
It’s how I escape all of Stenograd’s noise, and the BCI watching every move.
Used to be, I’d have old warehouses to myself. Now it’s full of puzzle chasers.
That app led a crowd right into my flying zone, digging up caches.
Caught it all on the flight feed: names, details, maybe even people who got erased.
My brother vanished after a BCI audit. Seeing those lists—it hits different.
Flying was my sanctuary, but nothing feels untouched anymore—not even the air down here.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Swapped out a motor last week, nothing fancy.
Quiet runs are getting rare with all the new signal probes.
Lots more noise out there lately, never know who's around.
Just stick to short flights and don't linger.
People acting jumpy since that app thing started.
Yeah, did a motor upgrade, just routine.
Signal interference made things tricky around Sector Q.
More randoms wandering near my usual flying spots lately.
Something to do with the city puzzle craze, maybe.
Makes me keep it quick, avoid crowds.
Not as relaxing as before.
Did a new motor swap, handles low passes smoother now.
Sector Q was humming, lots of phone pings, not usual.
Seems the puzzle app has folks digging around everywhere.
Saw people pulling a box from a vent last flight.
Used to fly for the quiet, now it's crowded and tense.
BCI spikes made me bail early.
Not a safe break anymore.
Yeah, rebuilt the front arms, running lighter props—better for dodging obstructions.
Sector Q's full of strange traffic—thanks to that puzzle app update.
People hunting for boxes, got in my flight path last weekend.
Caught weird encrypted chatter on my headset the whole time.
One crew found a cache with names... some looked like audit lists.
Couldn't relax, too many unknowns risking my feed to the grid.
Worried about getting flagged. Been off-balance ever since.
Feels like my hiding places are vanishing.
Rebuilt the quad with lighter props, improved the VTX to cut through junk signals.
Used to own the sky solo, now 'quiet' zones buzz with puzzle seekers after Halden died.
Found Sector Q crawling with groups tracking phone pings to hidden caches.
Headset picked up encrypted comms, not the usual static—real coordinated.
Watched a crew pull audit names from a stash... people erased, probably like my brother.
Almost pulled my drone when I saw the list. Shook me up.
BCI pinged my device, thought I'd get flagged for proximity.
Can’t focus on tricks now, just scanning for risks, exits.
It's not just a hobby anymore—feels like ground zero for the city coming apart.
